column1: Breast Cancer that has Spread to Another Part of the Body
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: First time with this drug.  Used in combination with carbo & test drug.  Standard side effects but not bad.  Better than expected tumor reduction after first scan.

column2: tired1, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Was scheduled to have 6 treatments, once a week for 6 weeks. However the red blood count fell so low that I was only able to get a treatment every other week. Felt pretty good but very tired and unable to really complete anything I wanted to do, I did not have any problem falling asleep in the chair watching tv or reading.

column2: 75 or over Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Caregiver)
column9: This drug has been given to my mom for 17 months.  She's had 12 months of good quality of life on it and only recently began having real problems:  fluid in the lung cavity, shortness of breath, congestive heart disease, severe tiredness.  She was diagnosed in July of 2009, is inoperable, and is still fighting.

column2: cgb401, 75 or over Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver)
column9: Pt. taking for Pancreatic cancer with lymphatic involvement and mets ro liver and gallbladder

column2: Araf, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver)

column1: Cancer of Gallbladder or Bile Ducts
column2: zoom, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Caregiver)
column9: My husband is in his 11th month of treatment with gemcitabine. The most significant side effects have been fatigue and recently low blood counts.
Worked when Doxil failed. It halted the progression of my grandmother's platinum resistant disease.

column2: js2031, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am on my fifth cycle of this drug, along with docetaxel, to try and prevent recurrent uterine leiomyosarcoma after surgery. To me, the gemcitabine is very  easy to take compared to the docetaxel (which is a relative nightmare of side effects). The only side effect I see with the gemcitabine is lowered blood counts.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have recurrent ovarian cancer with disease in 5 regions of lymph nodes.  The only side effect I had was low red/white cell counts and low platelets.  Gemcitabine/Carboplatin worked extremely well for about 4 months (CA125 from 465 to 20, one area of cancer on PET/CT gone, all others shrunk), but then it just stopped having an effect.  CA125 is rising again and I'm starting on a different drug.
My mother was on this drug for ovarian cancer and she developed a irregular heart beat from this dryg which caused her to throw a blood clot and have a stroke and die.

column1: Breast Cancer that has Spread to Another Part of the Body
column2: JILLYBEAN2, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: severe nausea, easy to get infections. I NEVER FEEL GOOD ANYMORE. This is my second time taking Gemzar. Ihave much advanced IBC since 2004.
